alert.note: Alert for Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 27 at 11:49AM EDT until May 27 at 12:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN STAFFORD AND KING GEORGE COUNTIES... At 1148 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Stafford to Fairview Beach to near Port Royal, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... King George, Dahlgren, Fairview Beach, Potomac Creek, Aquia Creek, Nanjemoy Creek, Port Royal, Passapatanzy, Weedonville, Ninde, Brooke, Lambs Creek, Sealston, Jersey, Berthaville, Shiloh and Dogue. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 PM EDT for southern Maryland...and central and northern Virginia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
